news.title: ‘Great error of judgment’: Regina Doherty says it’s ‘hard to accept’ Ceann Comhairle’s explanation over Sinn Féin photo call
news.summary: Fine Gael MEP Regina Doherty has said it is “hard to accept” the explanation from Ceann Comhairle Verona Murphy about her decision to pose for a photograph with Sinn Féin TDs and senators.

news.title: Employers warned of €50,000 fines and imprisonment for breaching new pension scheme rules
news.summary: Employers have been warned they may face fines of up to €50,000 and imprisonment for breaching the rules of the new national auto-enrolment pension scheme called My Future Fund.

news.title: Biggest public sector union Fórsa has gender pay gap over 21pc, report shows
news.summary: The average male worker at the largest public sector union earns over 21pc more than a female employee.

news.title: ‘I felt exhausted and lethargic for no reason but the answer was in my Irish genes’
news.summary: Ellen Troy, who suffered for years with lethargy and unexplained fatigue, recalls feeling exhausted for no reason.

news.title: Munster excited to get the ‘big rig’ Edwin Edogbo fired up again after his return from injury
news.summary: Had things worked out differently for Edwin Edogbo this month, he would likely have returned to Munster as a senior Ireland international.

news.title: Rising rents, RPZs and a ‘lonely place’ for landlords – what new RTB data tells us
news.summary: While new data has shown that Rent Pressure Zones (RPZs) are “effect­ive” in moderating increases, red flags in the market have not gone away as average rents in Dublin hit over €2,200 for new tenants.

news.title: Irish influencer Madison Cawley had 275,000 social media followers at her peak – then she deleted everything
news.summary: At the height of her teenage internet fame in 2016, Madison Cawley had 125,000 followers on Instagram and another 150,000 on Facebook.

news.title: A manor in quiet surrounds with the glitz of the K Club nearby
news.summary: 4 Lishandra Manor,  Ardclough, Straffan, Co Kildare

news.title: Bill Linnane: I took my teenage son to the Shrek Experience in London and realised I’m Donkey, the annoying sidekick who tags along
news.summary: When my son asked me to bring him and his friend to Radiohead in London, I said we would only do it on one condition. We would see as much of the city and as many museums as we could within the time we spent there.

news.title: Home economics: ‘Our father didn’t leave a will and we can’t agree on selling the house – what is the legal position on our dilemma?’
